MMs are eating so much having 4/5 expirations a months that they have to weight a tons each... and they are setting up for jan oe.... But I'm sure you already knew it.....

Topic.Title: With a 3,150 P/E

Message.Msg: The best and most successful fund managers never invest based on PE. Most do not even look at it. They analyze the business models. The legendary investors are not "lucky" when they ride the great growth stocks in America's history. Yet the little retail investor gets so bent out of shape when they see this number as if some injustice was done to them. You really have to laugh. You can read posts from the inception of this stock at $1.50 a share split adjusted and they were obsessing over the same nonsense. Many of the greatest stock investments were made in stocks that had a higher PE than AMZN. That's right, investing in companies that had no PE at all. Companies that could not even turn a profit. And no these companies were not start ups either.

Topic.Title: what's amazing is WS focused love on AMZN without profits yet and complete abandoment of AAPL that had historic profits

Message.Msg: one of my thought is that some of the support of AMZN is due to the fact that it has big information on habit of the people in the US and supports huge amounts of employment via it's platform: 3rd party sales etc. So the support of printing is directed to keep the stock supported from the highest levels out there. We all know the market has the invisible hand of gov't behind it and AMZN is the lead of that. in my view. So comparing it generically so some other type situation that existed in some stock in the past like CMG etc might a mistake? All I know is picking tops in AMZN has been a fools game for along time. The power has been on the support side and it may go to a very high level beyond just WS houses. I don't know.

Topic.Title: Anal Lists falling all over each other to see who can

Message.Msg: Goldman Sachs analyst Heather Bellini in Dec 2011 said this: “We believe already embedded in today’s multiple is the expectation of EPS estimates going higher in 2012, and thus for the stock to materially appreciate in the near term would require the company to beat and raise on the bottom line over the next few quarters. Given our lower operating forecasts for 2012, we see this scenario as unlikely.” At the time Goldman was estimating $65.6 billion in 2012 sales and $1.42 EPS and had a target of $190 on the stock. Fast forward one year, sales look likely to come in under that estimate and EPS way under. She was right in that EPS estimates did not go higher, in fact they came down significantly. However still the stock did appreciate materially. It would seem Goldman's new analyst has drank the kool-aid and despite the company falling short on both sales and earnings in 2012 has decided that instead of $190 the company should be worth $315.

Topic.Title: Bezos: It's Not About Profit

Message.Msg: actually that is what its about. This company is a front for a boiler room operation. Message.Title: Morgan Stanley Upgrade Of Amazon Ridiculous At Every Level
Message.Msg: So says new seeking-alpha author Timothy Phillips. Mr. Phillips has written 3 articles on seeking-alpha, all of them trashing AMZN. His profile is quite impressive, but I have to wonder why he believes he's so much smarter than Scott Devitt (the MS analyst), and Jeff Bezos for that matter. I comment on seeking-alpha, but my comments don't get posted until read by a moderator. Instead of crunching numbers to prove Amazon can't possibly be worth the levels its traded at, I think Mr. Phillips' time might be better spent reading everything Bezos has written, and figuring out exactly why the stock is being traded where it is. Because if you can't figure out why the price is what it is, you won't be able to predict future prices. Just saying "it has to come down sometime" is not good enough to risk your money.

Topic.Title: AMZN PE. IS VER CHEAP ONLY 3000. AAPL VERY HIGH 11.4

Message.Msg: That is easy to write. The issue with Amazon is their CEO does not want to be profitable. He has stated so in the past. He just wants the world's biggest company. So is it worthwhile to invest in Amazon? Maybe.... At some point Jeff might step down and when that happens new management will finally stop spending money. And this PE of 3000 could easily drop to realistic numbers. To value a 60 billion dollar company as though it is only a hundred million dollar company would be absurd. But maybe in the long term Amazon can prove it is worth 300/share. In my opinion, NO. Then again I'm looking at 10 years from now. And I see it making $20 a share. I think there is too much hype, and it will deflate. This is a stock at a price that is such a gamble that everything goes perfectly for a decade. I could see betting on amazon if it was $150. And holding it for a long term. But this valuation in my opinion is based purely on hoping some bigger idiot will buy your position for more. Good luck to all the idiots, and I hope there will be bigger idiots to make you rich.

Message.Title: Amazon not worth much as an investment
Message.Msg: It's a cool name. So is Wikipedia. So is Mozilla. All 3 have grown and become part of our pop culture but none of them make money. So why does Amazon's stock say it's worth $121 Billion. And unlike Mozilla and Wiki which are cool for school, Amazon has become the WalMart of the Internet- trying to sell everything to everybody. More and more sales of less and less profitable things, if you already have the rice and beans, maybe you'll buy the beans and rice. Honestly, What the heck kind of business has this become????

Topic.Title: Am I the only person who put Nasdaq_6000_Baby On Ignore?

Message.Msg: Stocktrader, Don't! I repeat DON'T put him on ignore. You need to see his posts. He will determine the best times to short the stock. Any time the Nasdaq-o-meter reads 50 ppd (post per day) your better off staying on the side lines. This weekend we hit over 50 so it was wise to stay cash on Monday. Monday we got pretty close to 100 ppd so you know to stay on the sidelines. reading of 2-3 ppd is ideal shorting days. Happy trading - PJ

Message.Title: MS and GS are trapped in a bad bond issue
Message.Msg: They cant find greater foolz then themselvez for financing amzn's ponzi scheme, even when they try to upgrade their way out of a self created disaster.... They are calling over to fidelity mutual fund managerz hoping that those idiots will accept the investment bank's unloaded into baggie 401k accounts, because no retailer on the planet iz buying theze 'upgradez'. The fund manager sayz on the phone to hiz ms pal "ok bobby, but you owe me a round of golf and a night at the strip club if i bury this into the 'aggressive growth' fund I'm running here. For chrrriiiist sakes, i gotta try to make the fund some money. I bought nflx from you at 280, what else can i do here, bob. This iz getting old." Wall street arsholez need to do something useful like learn how to wire a house or mix some concrete.... They wouldnt last a day.

Topic.Title: AMZN PE. IS VER CHEAP ONLY 3000. AAPL VERY HIGH 11.4

Message.Msg: What will do this company in iz its heroin like addiction to needing cash infusionz to support money losing growth. It will default on its bonds, and the issuerz MS and GS will smell the blood in the water and they will transform from pumperz looking for the greater fool into bond bully sharks to attemt to get 50 or 60 cents on their bond debt issue dollar. That alobe will leave the common stock holder with a seven cent / share stock and a class action lawsuit that might get them another 2 cents/ share if they are lucky.... Amzn iz a dot bomb company and an enron rolled into one hot tomale.

Topic.Title: Conflict of Interest

Message.Msg: Want to lose money fast? Read Paulo Santos and follow his advice. He's been short AMZN for months, perpahs longer. He's written article after article explaining why AMZN's price must come down, but the price keeps going up. So now he writes an article explaining that the analysts who raise AMZN's price target have a conflict of interest, and are just plain lying to us. Well, Mr. Santos, if you believe that, why do you invest in the stock market? Why try to short AMZN, don't you know that the investment banks are going to lie and raise their price target? Isn't that like playing craps with dice that are loaded against you?

Topic.Title: Conflict of Interest

Message.Msg: don't let media keep hoaxing you!
